text: Hindustani Lal Sena (, 'Indian Red Army') was an anticolonial guerrilla group in India. It was formed on 13 April 1939 (on the anniversary day of the Jallianwala Bagh massacre). It was founded by Maganlal Bagdi and Pandit Shyam Narain Kashmiri along with their associates. Indian Express. Guerrillas braved bullets in their march for freedom Pandit Shyam Narayan Kashmiri ==See also== * Lal Sena ==References== Category:Military units and formations established in 1939 Category:Revolutionary movement for Indian independence
title: Hindustani Lal Sena
